abstract: Charlotte, NC, officials announce Officer Randall Kerrick has resigned from Charlotte-Mecklenburg Police Dept after reaching settlement with city in his trial for voluntary manslaughter; Kerrick shot dead Jonathan Ferrell, unarmed black man, but his trial ended with deadlocked jury.
lead_paragraph: The officer, Randall Kerrick, resigned from the Charlotte-Mecklenburg Police Department effective Oct. 2, and received almost $113,000, the officials said.

headline.main: North Carolina: Officer Who Killed Driver Quits
headline.print_headline: North Carolina: Officer Who Killed Driver Quits

snippet: The officer, Randall Kerrick, resigned from the Charlotte-Mecklenburg Police Department effective Oct. 2, and received almost $113,000, the officials said.
